page.title: 18GREENSIDE - OUR VILLAGE.
page.content: Most of the men in Greenside were coal miners. When they got home their wives had the tin bath ready in front of a blazing fire. The other members of the family had to go into a different room in the house. The houses in our street have changed from what they used to be like. There was a picture hall near Mitton Street at one time. The "Temp" as it is known locally used to be called the Temperence Bar and it sold milk because temperence means non-alcoholic. The street next to the Temp was built by the miners.
